result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:02 AM Defendant Nicholas R Berg appeared by video, in custody at the Waupaca County Jail.   Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Nicholas R Berg.  Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin. 

ADA Cassidy calls the case and states the appearances.

Defendant requests to appear telephonically and confirms that he can hear. 
Defendant understands that if there are hearing problems to let the court know.

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.
Defendant is in custody on a PO Hold.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued. 
If not in custody will need to be present for the next scheduled PTC.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Exhibit #P1 Copy of Criminal Complaint

3:42 PM Defendant Nicholas R Berg appeared by video, in custody at the Waupaca County Jail.    Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Nicholas R Berg. 

3:43 p.m.  Exhibit #P1, copy of criminal complaint, marked for ADA Cassidy.

Court questions defendant and informs of the right to be present in the courtroom.
Defendant requests to appear telephonically and confirms that he can hear. 
Defendant understands that if there are hearing problems to let the court know.
If at any time the defendant needs to speak privately with his attorney, the court will make accommodations for that.
Defendant indicates he understands the right to be present in the courtroom and has discussed with his attorney.
BY THE COURT: Court finds the defendant is knowingly, intelligently, and voluntarily consenting to use of telephonic conferencing. 

3:45 p.m.  Officer A. Kyle of the Plover Police Department is sworn in.
Direct examination by ADA Cassidy.
3:50 p.m.  ADA Cassidy references Exhibit #P1. 
3:52 p.m.  Witness identifies the defendant.
Atty Bergner objects to questioning.
Cross examination by Atty Bergner.
3:56 p.m.  ADA Cassidy does not have any redirect.
Witness is excused.
ADA Cassidy has no additional witnesses.
ADA Cassidy moves exhibit #P1 into evidence.  No objection by Atty Bergner.  Received by the Court.
Atty Bergner has no witnesses.
ADA Cassidy has no argument.
Atty Bergner has no argument.
Atty Bergner would ask that a separate arraignment date be set.

BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial. 
Bond is continued
Arraignment scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Arraignment on September 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.
